author: Matthew Freedman
text: Thanks everyone. Good suggestions.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: Trying to find a movie to watch. What's a comedy released in the last 5 years that you think is good?

author: Matthew Freedman
text: What are the odds that the 49ers will find a trade partner for Jimmy Garoppolo?

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @ChrisKinda @dwainmcfarland I should say that I think Dwain is higher in Kyler than I am, because I have others with higher median outcomes.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@ChrisKinda @dwainmcfarland I know Dwain is high on Kyler.

A 5,000-1,000 QB is the dream. I doubt we actually see it happen.

But the guy who has the best chance of getting it this year is Kyler.

Better runner than the pure passers. Better passer than the runners. Josh Allen's offense will be too good.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
That's all for the AMA. Sorry if I didn't get to your questions. I'll be back tomorrow.

Until then, @FantasyPros subs can leave questions in my AMA Discord channel.

Discord: https://t.co/7isam7VgTE

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @DaveCummings71 @FantasyPros Habit. It's not uncommon in the fantasy space.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@awest421 Man, that's tough. Lots of places. I regularly use info from PFF, Pro Football Reference, and RotoViz.

And I'll be the company man and say that we have a good suite of research tools at @FantasyPros.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @BabaGanoush___ @FantasyPros You might be right. I think Deebo has a really wide range of outcomes.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @westcoastwashed @FantasyPros A lot of responses have had to do with Keenan. It seems that the public perception of him (based on the limited sample of respondents) is down. 📉

author: Matthew Freedman
Matthew Freedman
text: @Tha_JunT I've got DJ Moore at No. 11, so I'm not arguing with you.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @wentzff Thanks, I appreciate it.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @RumfordJohnny Love that call on Pittman. And, yeah, a lot of uncertainty in WRs this year.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @sfpd2217 Yeah, I think most people would agree with that now. Lamb could lead the league in targets.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @JeffPatwork Fewer receiving opportunities within the new offense, and a quarterback who isn't Mahomes. It's more about circumstances than about Tyreek's talent.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @MZavagno11 https://t.co/VPHYXEdKQZ

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@ShakedownSteve Down across the board is almost certain, if for no other reason than how his numbers were before.

But, yeah, Carr isn't as good as Rodgers, and Adams has way more competition for targets.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @Joe_Siniscalchi I like Lamar every year. I'm not drafting him b/c I prefer to wait on QB, but I think he does well.

author: Matthew Freedman
Matthew Freedman
text: @BrendanRiley_ A little, haha.

author: Matthew Freedman
Matthew Freedman
text:
@FantasyPrep101 Same tier. JJ is more of the long-term option b/c of his position. JT is maybe the guy to roster if you're looking to win right now.

I'd probably make the trade b/c I tend to prefer WRs in dynasty.

Based on our trade chart, they're almost even.

https://t.co/PX1gVS8xpz

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @Dwprix So top 10 still the same, but a different order.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @smark_power I like Albert O and Irv Smith.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @BabaGanoush___ @FantasyPros Deebo was awesome last year. But he was so efficient that it would be hard for him to repeat if everything else stayed the same, and with the switch to Lance the 49ers could rely more on the run, and Lance might be worse at passing than Jimmy G.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @DFishSAC @FantasyPros I can see it. I guess this perspective is more popular than I expected.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @bugs670 I could see it. I like the ceiling for Williams.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @JMUDuke77 I think the main concern is passing frequency in that offense.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@ballinballerr As long as those three teams are still internally correlated, I think the 3 teams.

Consensus rankings have Higgins at No. 11. I have him at No. 12. He's very close.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @joe_stich If not top 10, he (and probably Evans) would be on the borderline.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @adrianbahc I prefer Bateman. Worried about Dobbins' health and backfield split.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@LakeWarrick I'm not quite there with you, but I'm close. The Chargers need to get Williams the ball more, and I have ranked just one spot behind Allen.

I think Allen has a higher floor, Williams has the higher ceiling.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@BALIstik916 I want my league mates as distracted as possible. Tons of food and alcohol for them in a loud environment -- while I have minimal food and no drinks and block out the noise with a laser focus.

I swear I'm a normal human being.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@mvledonne Don't see a lot of value in keeping Chubb and Jones.

I'd keep Javonte.

If Deshaun gets only 4 games or so, I'd keep him as well.

If not, I think Dillon in 6th.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
Right now, here are the top 10 WRs in our expert consensus rankings:

1. Kupp
2. Jefferson
3. Ja'Marr
4. Diggs
5. Davante
6. Lamb
7. Evans
8. Deebo
9. Tyreek
10. Keenan

Where are we wrong?

And ask me anything.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
This isn't out of nowhere, but I'd be happy to say it whenever: If you're an aspiring fantasy football analyst, I can't think of a better place to get your start than @RotoViz.

Great people & tools. They will help you become a better writer & thinker.

That's where I started.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @RunawayLTrain1 Thanks for sticking with us. I think we've got some great preseason content in our draft kit, and I'm looking forward to seeing the in-season marquee pieces we have planned.

text: @FantasyKash @BoredOnToilet That's fair. I think their passing rate is also likely to regress. Partially b/c Daboll isn't there. And partially b/c what they did last year was abnormal.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @TLinny4Browns @FantasyPros No, but his short stature means he can run b/w the legs of would-be tacklers. https://t.co/1seyg4DXdm

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@Wi11Brown @FantasyPros Combo of talent and situation.

Allen has talent, but Bills won't need him to throw that much. Lamar and Hurts have the rushing ability, but I doubt they have the passing talent or opportunity.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @claws121 I do like him. MIN should play more 3-WR sets, so he gets more playing time. He's cheap, so he's basically all upside in case the MIN offense takes off. And he's an actual handcuff for Jefferson and Thielen.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @justdrewitt I think different situation. Still playing for his big payday and doesn't seem to hate the team. Not sure there is another guy like what you're describing this year.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @jedpro1 @FantasyPros I like him. He's got the rushing, but I doubt the Eagles pass enough for him to get there.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @tacitassassin13 @IkeyAzar Great tweet.

author: Matthew Freedman
Matthew Freedman
text:
@bwaggoner531 Kyler Murray, Lamar Jackson, Jalen Hurts, Josh Allen.

And, dammit, maybe Trey Lance and Justin Fields.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @D_Rex787 np, thx man.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @IkeyAzar By running for his life and either getting out of bounds or sliding.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @AndrewRome17 It's mainly about age with Thielen and the injuries piling up. Also ... I don't think we can assume that the passing game will be better, or that it will be better for Thielen. It probably will be, but it's not a given.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @Dynastysfm1999 @FantasyPros If he does this, it would definitely involve a lot of good fortune, some of which would be staying healthy.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @NolanHerlihy @FantasyPros It's not as if I'm the only person who has said this. It's about talent, circumstance, fast play speed, a deep ball WR, and luck.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @Gilligan54 Some of the rookies, but nothing big.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @JoshDav54852469 @FantasyPros Yes, I think he's got the upside. Playing fast, throwing a lot, and having Hollywood down the field.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @602Sherlock It's an upside assessment. It would involve deep passing success with Hollywood and the need for a pass-heavy game script.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @ArbitraryPicks Maybe.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @D_Rex787 I'd do Chase for a 4th. Love the value there.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@BoredOnToilet Jackson doesn't have the passing upside of Kyler, and Allen's team doesn't need him to throw often enough to reach 5,000 yards.

In raw talent, Allen has the best chance, but his situation holds him back.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@johndavidmac1 I wouldn't worry about the same team thing with Chase. Both players are studly enough to produce.

But the 0.25 points per carry pushes me toward Jones. I love his upside this year: The Packers could run the ball more, and Jones could be used more as a receiver.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @Wi11Brown @FantasyPros That's correct, Murray hasn't done it ... yet. For every QB in NFL history with 4,000 yards, at one point in time he was a dude who hadn't thrown 4,000 yards yet.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @aznewokmasta I'd look at FFPC and Underdog. I believe there's a special deal at @FantasyPros where you get a free subscription when you sign up at Underdog.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @spb736 I'm on Lamb, Diontae, McLaurin. Nothing against Jeudy, but I think he has more bust potential than the other guys.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @Canada__Dude @FantasyPros Yeah, especially because of his age. Even if we thought he was likely to play this year -- and it doesn't seem like it at all -- his age makes him an easy cut candidate.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@JackJablonski Yeah. He has the talent. The "problem" for him is that the Bills are too good, so the team won't need to have Allen throw that often and aggressively to win games.

Harder for him to get to 5,000 yards.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @BALIstik916 I like Isaiah Spiller, Brian Robinson, Gus Edwards, and Tyrion Davis-Price.

author: Matthew Freedman
text:
@YoungGun1922 I respectfully disagree. I think the Ravens will shift back toward the running game, especially after trading away Hollywood.

Lamar definitely has a better chance to get 1,000 yards rushing, but Kyler has the edge on passing upside.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @MasonM1997 I could see the 1,000 yards with Hurts, but not anywhere close to 5,000. I think 4,000 is his ceiling unless the Eagles drastically shift toward the passing game.

author: Matthew Freedman
text: @kucoy71 I have him as the rookie WR3 behind Drake and Treylon. Like him a lot. If you wanted him before Treylon, I wouldn't think that's wrong.
